attributes.action: acknowledge on behalf of all Londoners tat the comments of the Mayor Ken Livingstone are his own and do not represent London as a whole
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: We do not feel that 200 years after the abolition of slavery in this country that Londoners owe anyone an apology for this trade and condemn the Mayor for using this emotive issue for cheap electioneering. We hope that the Prime minister will join us in condemning the actions of the Mayor and asserting that to apologise on behalf of others infers guilt, of which Londoners of all races today have none

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
